title: Of all the bridges to the Brunswick beaches: Oak Island, Holden Beach, Ocean Isle and Sunset Beach, the one to Holden Beach appears to be the highest and hooks far to right as you get to the ocean side. Why is so much higher? Why does it hook? Why are the retaining wall so low for such a high bridge?
text:
Here's a link to the answer to your question.



http://www.myreporter.com/?p=11952
